ARABIC: إِنِّىٓ أَنَا۠ رَبُّكَ فَٱخْلَعْ نَعْلَيْكَ إِنَّكَ بِٱلْوَادِ ٱلْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: I am your Lord. Take off your sandals. You are in the holy valley of Tuwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: O Moses, I am verily your Lord, so take off your shoes, for you are in the holy plain of Towa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Verily I am your Lord! Take off your shoes. You are in the sacred valley, Tuwa!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: I Am your Lord. Take off your shoes; you are in the holy valley of Tuwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Indeed I am your Lord, therefore take off your shoes; indeed you are in the holy valley of Tuwa!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, I am your Lord! So take off your shoes; you are in the sacred valley, Tuwa."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely I am your Lord, therefore put off your shoes; surely you are in the sacred valley, Tuwa,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: I am thy Lord; put off thy shoes; thou art in the holy valley, Towa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! I, even I, am thy Lord, So take off thy shoes, for lo! thou art in the holy valley of Tuwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: I am your Lord! Take off your sandals, for you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily I! I am thy Lord: so take off thy shoes; verily thou art into the holy valley, Tuwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed I am your Lord! So take off your sandals. You are indeed in the sacred valley of Tuwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Verily I am thy Lord! therefore (in My presence) put off thy shoes: thou art in the sacred valley Tuwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily! I am your Lord! So take off your shoes, you are in the sacred valley, Tuwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: I am your Lord. Take off your shoes, for you are in Towa, the sacred valley.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: I—I am your Lord. Take off your shoes. You are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:12] Indeed (read as innī, if one understands nūdiya, ‘he was called’, as meaning qīla, ‘it was said’; or read it as annī, because of an implied [prefixed] bā’) I am (anā, reiterates the [first person indicator] yā’ [of innī] used by the [direct] speaker) your Lord. So take off your sandals, for lo! you are in the holy, [meaning] either the pure, or the blessed, valley of Tuwā ([this is] either a substitution, or an explicative supplement; read [Tuwan] with nunation or [Tuwā] without: it is [considered] declinable on account of it being a location; but [alternatively considered] indeclinable, if taken as considered a feminine proper noun denoting a place name).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! I, even I, am thy Lord. So take off thy shoes) for his shoes were made of the skin of a dead ass, (for Lo! thou art in the holy valley of Tuwa) Tuwa is the name of the valley; it also said that Tuwa means: this valley has been crossed (tawathu) by prophets before you; it is also said that Tuwa is a well which was filled with stones (tuwiyyat bi'l-sakhr) in the valley where he found the tree.
